casebody.data:
988 A.2d 511 ATTORNEY GRIEVANCE COMMISSION OF MARYLAND v. Frank M. COSTANZO. No. 13,

Sept. Term, 2009.

Court of Appeals of Maryland. Feb. 9, 2010. Fletcher P. Thompson, Asst. Bar Counsel (Melvin Hirshman, Bar Counsel, Atty. Grievance Com’n), for petitioner. No argument on behalf of Respondent.

*474Argued before BELL, C.J., HARRELL, BATTAGLIA, GREENE, MURPHY, ADKINS and BARBERA, JJ.

PER CURIAM ORDER.

For reasons to be stated in an opinion later to be filed, it is this 9th day February, 2010,

ORDERED, by the Court of Appeals of Maryland, that Frank M. Costanzo be, and he is hereby, disbarred, effective immediately, from the further practice of law in the State of Maryland; and it is further

ORDERED that the Clerk of this Court shall strike the name of Frank M. Costanzo from the register of attorneys, and pursuant to Maryland Rule 16-713, shall certify that fact to the Trustees of the Client Protection Fund and the clerks of all judicial tribunals in the State; and it is further

ORDERED that respondent shall pay all costs as taxed by the Clerk of this Court, including the costs of all transcripts pursuant to Maryland Rule 16-715(c), for which sum judgment is entered in favor of the Attorney Grievance Commission of Maryland against Frank M. Costanzo.

Is/ Robert M. Bell Chief Judge
